title: Veritas inconcussa or, a most certain truth asserted, that King Charles the First, was no man of blood, but a martyr for his people. Together with a sad, and impartial enquiry, whether the King or Parliament began the war, which hath so much ruined, and undone the kingdom of England? and who was in the defensive part of it? By Fabian Philipps Esq;
author: Philipps, Fabian, 1601-1690.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed by Richard Hodgkinson, in the year 1649. and reprinted by Thomas Newcomb, and are to be sold by William Place at Grayes-Inn-Gate,
